availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: George Willis Lindsay (Trigg County, Kentucky, physician.)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Son of Lunsford Lindsay and Elizabeth Lindsay. Attended school in Trigg County, Kentucky, in 1850. Household owned five enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1850. Physician in Trigg County in 1860. Household owned eighteen enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 290A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, District 1, p. 226.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 192.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 392A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, p. 50A.
"Death of Geo. W. Lindsay," Semi-Weekly South Kentuckian (Hopkinsville, KY), March 1, 1887, p. 4.
"George Willis Lindsay (1834-1887)," Find A Grave, Memorial 124274037, accessed April 14, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/124274307.
